title: I AM: Before Abraham Was
subtitle: When Jesus claims eternity and the mob grabs stones

key_verse.text: Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.

cards.title: The Feast of Tabernacles: Setting the Stage
cards.subtitle: Why this conversation happens where and when it does
cards.content:
This confrontation occurs during the Feast of Tabernacles (Sukkot), one of Israel's three mandatory pilgrimage feasts. Understanding the context is crucial:

ğŸ›ï¸ THE LOCATION:
â€¢ Jesus is in the Temple treasury (John 8:20)
â€¢ This is where the four giant candelabras stood
â€¢ During Sukkot, these menorahs were lit to commemorate the pillar of fire in the wilderness
â€¢ The light was so bright it illuminated all Jerusalem

ğŸ”¥ THE SYMBOLISM:
â€¢ The pillar of fire represented God's presence guiding Israel
â€¢ It was a constant reminder that YHWH dwelt among them
â€¢ The illuminated Temple declared: 'God is here'

ğŸ’¡ JESUS'S CLAIM (8:12):
In THIS context, Jesus declares: 'I am the light of the world.'

He's not just using a nice metaphor. He's claiming to BE the reality that the candelabras only symbolized. He is the true pillar of fire. He is the manifest presence of YHWH.

âš”ï¸ THE RISING TENSION:
By John 8:58, this debate has been escalating for hours. Jesus has:
â€¢ Called them children of the devil (8:44)
â€¢ Claimed to know Abraham personally (8:56)
â€¢ Said Abraham 'rejoiced to see my day'

Now comes the climax.
cards.revelation_key: Jesus didn't choose random moments to make radical claims. Every 'I AM' statement was placed in a context designed to make His identity unmistakable.

ğŸ“Š THE GRAMMAR:
The aorist tense marks a definite historical event. Abraham didn't always exist - he CAME TO BE at a specific moment when God called him.

ğŸ”¥ THE SHOCK:
Jesus doesn't say:

â€¢ 'I existed before Abraham' (emphasizing sequence)

He says: 'I AM' - using the eternal present tense that transcends time itself.

greek_words.meaning: To come into being, to be born
greek_words.revelation: This verb marks created beings. Everything that 'came to be' had a Creator - including Abraham.
This is the name of God. Not 'I was' or 'I will be' - but the eternal, self-existent ONE who simply IS.

cards.revelation_key: The grammar itself is a theological statement. Abraham 'became.' Jesus 'IS.' One had a beginning. The Other is the Beginning.

cards.title: The Stones: Why They Understood Perfectly
cards.subtitle: John 8:59 - Proof that they got the message
cards.content:
Immediately after Jesus says 'I AM,' the text records:

'Then took they up stones to cast at him...' (John 8:59a)

ğŸª¨ WHY STONES?

This wasn't a spontaneous mob riot. It was a calculated legal execution attempt based on Mosaic Law:

ğŸ“œ LEVITICUS 24:16:
'And he that blasphemeth the name of the LORD, he shall surely be put to death, and all the congregation shall certainly stone him: as well the stranger, as he that is born in the land, when he blasphemeth the name of the LORD, shall be put to death.'

âš¡ THE CHARGE: BLASPHEMY

Under Jewish law, blasphemy wasn't just 'saying bad things about God.' It had a very specific definition:
â€¢ Pronouncing the sacred Name (YHWH) to attribute deity to oneself
â€¢ Taking God's exclusive identity and claiming it as your own

This is EXACTLY what Jesus did. By saying 'EgÅ Eimi' in this context, He was claiming:
1ï¸âƒ£ Pre-existence before all created things
2ï¸âƒ£ The divine Name revealed at the burning bush
3ï¸âƒ£ Equality with the Father

âŒ IF JESUS WERE JUST A TEACHER:

The Jews would have dismissed Him as:
â€¢ A lunatic (delusional)
â€¢ A heretic (theologically confused)
â€¢ A demon-possessed man (8:48 - they already suggested this)

But they didn't dismiss Him. They tried to KILL Him.

âœ… WHY? BECAUSE THEY UNDERSTOOD:

No 1st-century Jew would misunderstand 'EgÅ Eimi' in this context. They knew:
â€¢ The Shema: 'Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God is ONE LORD' (Deut 6:4)
â€¢ The sacred Name from Exodus 3:14
â€¢ The penalty for blasphemy

Their violence was their theology exam. They got an A+ in comprehension - and an F in faith.

scripture_connections.text: And God said unto Moses, I AM THAT I AM: and he said, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, I AM hath sent me unto you
And he that blasphemeth the name of the LORD, he shall surely be put to death

cards.revelation_key: The stones prove the claim. If Jesus were only saying He existed before Abraham, they might argue theology. But claiming 'I AM' meant claiming to BE God - and that demanded either worship or execution.

cards.title: The Supernatural Exit: EkrybÄ“
cards.subtitle: When the Light hides from those who chose darkness
cards.content:
After they grab stones, something remarkable happens:

'...but Jesus hid himself (á¼ÎºÏÏÎ²Î·), and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.' (John 8:59b)

ğŸ” THE WORD: EKRYBÄ’ (á¼ÎºÏÏÎ²Î·)

â€¢ Strong's G2928: ÎºÏÏÏ€Ï„Ï‰ (kryptÅ)
â€¢ Form: Aorist passive indicative
â€¢ Root meaning: 'To hide, to conceal, to encrypt'
â€¢ English derivatives: 'Crypt,' 'cryptic,' 'encryption'

âš¡ WHY 'PASSIVE' MATTERS:

The passive voice (ekrybÄ“) means 'He WAS hidden' - not 'He hid Himself.'

This suggests divine intervention:
â€¢ God the Father concealed Him
â€¢ A supernatural veil fell over their eyes
â€¢ The Light made Himself invisible to those who rejected Him

ğŸš¶ 'GOING THROUGH THE MIDST OF THEM':

This phrase is crucial. Jesus didn't:
â€¢ Sneak out a side door
â€¢ Run away in fear
â€¢ Hide behind a pillar

He walked THROUGH THE CENTER of an armed mob ready to execute Him.

ğŸ’­ THE THEOLOGICAL IRONY:

1ï¸âƒ£ Jesus had just claimed to be 'the Light of the world' (8:12)
2ï¸âƒ£ They rejected the Light
3ï¸âƒ£ Now the Light 'hides' from them - a form of judgment

ğŸ”¦ OTHER USES OF KRYPTÅŒ (G2928):

â€¢ Matthew 11:25 - God 'hides' truth from the wise and prudent
â€¢ Luke 19:42 - Peace is 'hidden' from Jerusalem's eyes as judgment
â€¢ Colossians 3:3 - Our life is 'hidden' with Christ in God (protection)

ğŸ¯ THE PATTERN:

This isn't the first time Jesus does this:
â€¢ Luke 4:30 - At Nazareth, they tried to throw Him off a cliff, but 'passing through the midst of them he went his way'

Both times, Jesus demonstrates that:
â€¢ No one can take His life - He lays it down willingly (John 10:18)
â€¢ His 'hour' had not yet come (John 7:30)
â€¢ He is sovereign even over attempted murder

greek_words.revelation: The passive voice hints at the divine passive - God hid Him. The Light withdrew from those who preferred darkness.

cards.revelation_key: Jesus doesn't escape like a fugitive. He departs like a King who decides, 'This is not my time.' His exit is as supernatural as His claim - both prove His deity.

discovery_questions.question: Jesus used grammar itself to prove His eternity. What are the implications for your life if the carpenter from Nazareth is actually the eternal 'I AM' who existed before creation?

The Jewish leaders understood Jesus's claim perfectly - and chose stones over surrender. When confronted with Christ's deity today, what 'stones' do people grab instead of worshiping (intellectualism, mockery, avoidance)?
Jesus walked calmly through a murderous mob because 'His hour had not yet come.' How does Christ's absolute sovereignty over His own death change the way you view His sovereignty over your life?

prayer.title: Prayer of Worship to the Eternal I AM
prayer.content: Lord Jesus, You are the I AM - the One who exists outside of time, before Abraham, before creation, before anything came to be. You are not a created being. You are the Creator. You are not bound by time. You are the Ancient of Days and the eternal Present. I confess that You alone are God. Like those in the Temple, I have a choice: to pick up stones of rejection or to fall on my knees in worship. Today I choose worship. I acknowledge that You are LORD - the same Name revealed to Moses at the burning bush. You are the Light of the World, and I ask that You would not hide from me as You did from those who rejected You. Open my eyes to see Your glory. Give me faith to believe what even Your enemies understood: that You are God in human flesh. In Your eternal Name, the Name above all names, Amen.
